entry.et: Middle English applien, from Anglo-French aplier, from Latin applicare, from ad- + plicare to fold ply

def.dt: :to put to use especially for some practical purpose applies pressure to get what he wants
:to bring into action apply the brakes
:to lay or spread on apply varnish
:to put into operation or effect apply a law
:to employ diligently or with close attention should apply yourself to your work
:to have relevance or a valid connection this rule applies to freshmen only
:to make an appeal or request especially in the form of a written application apply for a job
